meta.name: description
meta.content: Brazos Independent School District is a public school district based in Wallis, Texas (USA). The district lies in two counties, Austin and Fort Bend. In addition to Wallis, the district also serves the city of Orchard.

div.marquee: Brazos ISD will be closed until May 4, 2020 due to the impact of the COVID-19 virus. All athletic events have been cancelled during this time.

h1.style: font: bold 15px/15px 'Nunito Sans', sans-serif; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; color: #9c3d3f; display: block; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal;

p.span: The links provide resources for students who are currently receiving Adult Transition Services.

div.style: margin: 0px; padding: 5px 0px; border: 0px currentColor; border-image: none;

li.span: Texas Transition - This website provides information and resources to assist families so that they can support their child’s transition process. On this site you will find further resources on self-determination, education/training, employment, and independent living.
National Technical Assistance Center - National Technical Assistance Center on Transition provides information and resources for Transition Planning, Graduation and Post School Success.
Garrett Center - This website provides information and resources on transition and other special education topics to educators and families of students from early childhood through 18+.

Iris Center - This website is a national center dedicated to improving education outcomes for all children especially those with disabilities birth through 18+, through the use of effective evidence based practices. Parents can access the modules that cover various topics from behavior to transition.

div.style: margin: 0px; padding: 5px 0px; border: 0px currentColor; border-image: none;
padding: 0px 10px 0px 0px; vertical-align: middle; float: left;
width: 890px; height: 0px; line-height: 0px; overflow: hidden; clear: both; font-size: 0px; display: block; visibility: hidden;
margin: 0px; padding: 5px 0px; border: 0px currentColor; border-image: none;

h1.style: margin: 0px; padding: 0px; color: #9c3d3f; line-height: 15px; font-family: 'Nunito Sans', sans-serif; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; display: block; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal;

a.style: color: #234a67; font-weight: 700; text-decoration: none; cursor: pointer;

ul.li:
These links provide support for students with Autism.
School Clousure Toolkit - For a child with autism, visual supports can help to decrease anxiety and increase independence across all settings. This toolkit provides you with all that you will need to help structure your child’s day at home, no matter his/her age.
Visual Schedule - Visual Schedule for Home
Autism Modules - AIM provides training in a variety of strategies and interventions targeted for students on the Autism Spectrum.
Autism Teacher Strategies - Supports and Strategies to facilitate appropriate social, emotional and communication skills for students.
Cleaning Up Visual Schedule - Visual Schedule for Cleaning up after Meals

div.style: margin: 0px; padding: 5px 0px; border: 0px currentColor; border-image: none;

h1.style: margin: 0px; padding: 0px; color: #9c3d3f; line-height: 15px; font-family: 'Nunito Sans', sans-serif; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; display: block; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal;

div.style: padding: 0px 10px 0px 0px; vertical-align: middle; float: left;
width: 890px; height: 0px; line-height: 0px; overflow: hidden; clear: both; font-size: 0px; display: block; visibility: hidden;

h1.style: font: bold 15px/15px 'Nunito Sans', sans-serif; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; color: #9c3d3f; display: block; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal;

a.style: color: #234a67; font-weight: 700; text-decoration: none; cursor: pointer;

p.span: The links will provide resources to support students who have behavioral challenges, or self -regulating behaviors.

div.style: margin: 0px; padding: 5px 0px; border: 0px currentColor; border-image: none;

li.span: Behavior/Self-Regulation - STEPS to locate Supports: Steps: 1. Click on Educator. 2. Click on Autism or Behavior, and 3. Click on Visual Supports File Library.
Autism Circuit - Library of Visual Supports to support appropriate behavior.
Parenting Tools - Parenting tools for various behaviors.
Do 2 Learn - Library of resources: Tips and tools, games, and songs to support behavior.
IBCCES - IBCCES provides information on Autism Spectrum Disorders and 15 Behavior Strategies for Children on the Autism Spectrum.
Child Mind Institute - The Child Mind Institute provides parents with Strategies for Managing Child Behavior Problems at Home.

span.style: text-align: left; color: #333333; text-transform: none; text-indent: 0px; letter-spacing: normal; font-family: 'Nunito Sans', sans-serif; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-weight: 400; word-spacing: 0px; float: none; display: inline !important; white-space: normal; orphans: 2; widows: 2; background-color: #ffffff; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;

li.span: Positive Phrasing - Visual Support for Parents regarding the Power of Positive Phrasing

span.style: text-align: left; color: #333333; text-transform: none; text-indent: 0px; letter-spacing: normal; font-family: 'Nunito Sans', sans-serif; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-weight: 400; word-spacing: 0px; float: none; display: inline !important; white-space: normal; orphans: 2; widows: 2; background-color: #ffffff; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;

li.span: Offering Choices - Visual Support for Parents regarding Offering Choices

span.style: text-align: left; color: #333333; text-transform: none; text-indent: 0px; letter-spacing: normal; font-family: 'Nunito Sans', sans-serif; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-weight: 400; word-spacing: 0px; float: none; display: inline !important; white-space: normal; orphans: 2; widows: 2; background-color: #ffffff; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;

li.span: Yoga for Kids - Yoga poses to assist students in calming down

span.style: text-align: left; color: #333333; text-transform: none; text-indent: 0px; letter-spacing: normal; font-family: 'Nunito Sans', sans-serif; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-weight: 400; word-spacing: 0px; float: none; display: inline !important; white-space: normal; orphans: 2; widows: 2; background-color: #ffffff; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;

li.span: Regulate Emotional Verbal Outbursts - Activity designed for students on the Autism Spectrum to learn ways to regulate emotional verbal outburst.
Five Count Breathing - Visual Support for 5 count breathing exercises to assist in calming down.
Self Control Remote Control - Self-Control "remote control" to assist students with regulating their emotions and behaviors.
Sample Schedule - Sample Schedule to continue structuring your child's daily activities.

div.style: margin: 0px; padding: 5px 0px; border: 0px currentColor; border-image: none;

li.span: COVID-19 Social Story - A social story to cover staying healthy in the wake of the Corona Virus. This social story utilizes basic visuals to explain the current virus, why school is closed, and how a student can remain healthy.

li.span: COVIBOOK - A short book explaining the Coronavirus for children. Available in multiple languages.

li.span: Reading Bear - Reading Bear targets learning letter sounds, provides videos and quizzes.

li.span: Read Theory - Read Theory focuses on reading comprehension and allows parents to set up free accounts and track their child's progress. It offers leveled reading passages and quizzes regarding passages.

div.div: School Report Card The purpose of the SRC is to inform parents and guardians about a campus's individual characteristics and its academic performance. Brazos Elementary School Brazos Middle School Brazos High School Prairie Harbor Alternative SchoolRead more...

p.span: Our vision:

div.p: BRAZOS ISD inspires each student to become a productive citizen who demonstrates leadership, passion, and self-reliability. We foster a culture of respect, community, perseverance, and achievement.

p.span: Brazos Independent School District

br.span:
P.O. Box 819 | 227 Educator Lane | Wallis, Texas 77485
Phone: (979) 478-6551

p.span: It is the policy of Brazos Independent School District not to discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, handicap, or age in its employment practices as required by Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, as amended; Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972; the Age Discrimination Act of 1975, as amended; and Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended.
